text.section: This section applies only in Calvert County.
The Board of License Commissioners may issue a special beer, wine and spirits tasting (BWST) license to a holder of a Class A beer and wine license or a Class A beer, wine and liquor license.

section.section:
Subject to paragraph (2) of this subsection, a BWST license entitles a holder of:
A Class A beer and wine license to allow tastings of wine or beer and wine; and
A Class A beer, wine and liquor license to hold tastings of wine, beer and wine, or beer, wine and liquor.
To hold a tasting, a holder of a BWST license shall provide alcoholic beverages to consumers at no charge.

text.section:
A person may consume alcoholic beverages covered by a BWST license in a quantity not exceeding:
1 ounce from a single brand of beer or wine; and
One-half ounce from a single brand of any other alcoholic beverage.
A BWST license entitles the holder to hold tastings 365 days per year.
A single tasting held under a BWST license may not exceed 3 hours.

section.section: An applicant for a BWST license shall submit to the Board of License Commissioners an application on the form that the Board of License Commissioners provides.
The Board of License Commissioners may issue a BWST license without a hearing.
A renewal of a BWST license shall be made at the time that the Class A beer and wine or Class A beer, wine and liquor license is renewed.

text.section:
The annual fee for a BWST license is:
$200, if the license is used for wine;
$250, if the license is used for beer or wine; and
$300, if the license is used for beer, wine and liquor.
